snippet: Toyota, once again the world’s biggest automaker, has received a boost from the weak yen and from efforts to improve quality and rethink design.
abstract: Toyota Motor raises its profit forecast for the full financial year by 10 percent, to 860 billion yen, as the world's largest automaker records return to profit levels not seen in years; net profit was 99.9 billion yen, or $1.1 billion, in the three months through December, 23.5 percent increase from year earlier; sales for quarter climbed 26 percent, to 16.2 trillion yen.
lead_paragraph: Toyota, once again the world’s biggest automaker, has received a boost from the weak yen and from efforts to improve quality and rethink design.

headline.seo: Toyota Says It Is Primed for a Lucrative Year
headline.main: Toyota Says It Expects a Big Gain in 2013 Sales
headline.print_headline: Toyota Says It Expects A Big Gain In 2013 Sales
